docs.title: 🍰 Coding & Cupcakes
docs.text:
Welcome to your sweet journey into AI-assisted coding! This workshop is all about using GitHub Copilot as your coach, teacher, and pair programmer—not your replacement.

Let’s bake some code together! 🧁

Video created with sora in Azure AI Foundry Video Playground

docs.title: 🚀 Copilot as an Enabler
docs.text:
Use Copilot to: - Refactor messy code - Add comments - Write tests

It helps you level up your own code—not skip the hard parts.

docs.title: 🤝 Copilot as a Pair Programmer
docs.text:
Let’s build a Cupcake Rating Form together! You write the HTML/CSS, Copilot helps with JavaScript.

💡 Tip: Guide it with comments like: ```js // Add validation for the rating input

docs.title: 👩‍🏫 Copilot as a Teacher
docs.text: Try this: ```js // What does this function do? function mystery(a, b) { return a ** b; }

docs.title: 🧠 The Mindset Shift
docs.text:
Welcome to the most important ingredient in your Coding & Cupcakes journey: your mindset! 🍰

GitHub Copilot is a powerful tool—but like any good kitchen assistant, it works best when you’re in charge. This section is all about helping you shift from passive coding to active learning.

docs.title: 🍩 Copilot is NOT your baker
docs.text:
Let’s get this straight:

❌ Copilot is not here to bake the cupcakes for you. ✅ Copilot is here to help you bake better cupcakes.

Think of it like this: - You bring the creativity, curiosity, and control. - Copilot brings suggestions, explanations, and shortcuts.

docs.title: 🧁 What is “Vibe Coding”? And why avoid it?
docs.text:
Vibe Coding is when you let Copilot write code without understanding it. You vibe with the suggestions, accept them blindly, and hope for the best.

🚫 This leads to: - Code you can’t debug - Features you can’t explain - Skills you don’t develop

Instead, we want to learn actively.

docs.title: 1. Ask Copilot to explain code
docs.text:
# What does this function do?
def bake(cupcakes):
    return sorted(cupcakes)

Copilot will add comments or explain the logic. You learn while you code!

docs.title: 2. Use Copilot to explore alternatives
docs.text:
// Show me another way to write this loop
for (let i = 0; i < cupcakes.length; i++) {
  console.log(cupcakes[i]);
}

You’ll see different patterns and styles—great for growing your coding vocabulary.

docs.title: 3. Prompt Copilot with learning goals
docs.text:
// I want to learn how to validate form inputs

Copilot will guide you through examples, but you still write and test the code.

docs.title: 4. Use Copilot to review your work
docs.text:
// Suggest improvements to this function
function rateCupcake(flavor, rating) {
  return `${flavor} gets a ${rating}/5!`;
}

Copilot can help you refactor, optimize, or add error handling.

docs.title: 🍭 Copilot is your Coding Coach
docs.text:
Here’s what a good coach does: - Encourages you to try - Explains when you’re stuck - Challenges you to improve

Copilot can do all of this—if you treat it like a coach, not a crutch.

docs.title: 🎂 Cupcake Coding Tips
docs.text:
• 🍰 Comment often: Use comments to guide Copilot and clarify your intent.
  • 🧁 Review everything: Don’t accept suggestions blindly—read, tweak, and understand.
  • 🍩 Ask questions: Use Copilot to learn why something works, not just how.
  • 🍬 Stay curious: Explore new patterns, libraries, and techniques with Copilot’s help.

docs.title: 💖 Final Thought
docs.text:
You’re here to learn, grow, and bake amazing code. Copilot is your sweet sidekick—but you’re the star of the show. 🌟

Let’s whisk up some wisdom and bake brilliance together! 🧁

docs.title: Demo 5 Ways to write this function
🧁 Welcome!
docs.text:
Thanks for joining She Codes Australia for this deliciously fun workshop! Today, we’ll explore how to use GitHub Copilot to become a better coder—not a lazier one.

“Copilot is your sous-chef, not your baker.” 👩‍🍳

Your browser does not support the video tag.

Video created with sora in Azure AI Foundry Video Playground

docs.title: Key Takeaways:
docs.text:
• You’re the baker. Copilot is your sous-chef.
  • Use it to learn, not to cheat.
  • Ask questions. Stay curious.
